trans-unit.source: Provides a mandatory base class for all activity designer components.
All activity designer components derive from <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner>.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> provides a simple designer which lets the user visually design activities in the design mode.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> provides a simple mechanism for the activities so they can participate in rendering the workflow on the design surface.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> lets the user customize layout and drawing associated with the activity.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> lets the user extend the metadata associated with the activity.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> class.
Gets an <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> that accessibility applications use to adjust the application UI for users who have impairments.
If no <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> is currently assigned to the control, a new instance of one is created.

To get or set the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.AccessibilityObject%2A> property, you must add a reference to the Accessibility assembly installed with the .NET Framework.
For more information about accessible objects, see the Active Accessibility section of the MSDN Library.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> associated with the control.
Gets the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> associated with the designer.
Use the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> to access the properties and events of the activity.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> associated with the designer.
Gets a <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> which contains the value for the enclosing rectangle of the designer in logical coordinates.
You can use the rectangle returned by the bounds method to determine the area enclosed by the designer plus the selection area.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that encloses the designer.
Returns a value that indicates if a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.CompositeActivity"></xref> can be set as the parent of the activity associated with the designer.
This method is useful for testing whether a designer can be parented by a particular <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner>.
This method is called when a user initiates an insertion operation, such as drag-and-drop or paste.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref> which can potentially be set as parent.
`true` if a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.CompositeActivity"></xref> can be set as the parent of the activity associated with the designer; otherwise, `false`.

Returns a value that indicates whether a connection can be created between the specified connection point on the current activity designer and the specified connection point on a target activity designer.
Unless overridden in a derived class, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.CanConnect%2A> always returns `true`.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConnectionPoint"></xref> to check on the current activity designer.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConnectionPoint"></xref> to check on the target activity designer.
`true` to indicate that a connection can be created between source and target; otherwise, `false`.
Creates a workflow view for the current activity designer using the specified ViewTechnology.
Unless overridden in a derived class, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.CreateView%2A> displays the default design-time layout for the activity.
The ViewTechnology to use to create the workflow view.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> that contains the current activity designer.
Gets the array of actions associated with configuration errors.
This method returns a read-only array of actions associated with configuration errors.

This list contains all configuration and validation errors for the Activity which can be presented to the end-user or used programmatically by the system hosting the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner>.
A read-only array of <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction"></xref>.
Gets the current designer theme for the activity designer.
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme"></xref> that contains theme settings for the activity designer.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
Releases the resources used by the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> class.

`true` if the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> is being disposed; `false` if the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> is being finalized.
Performs the default UI action associated with the designer.
Use this method to perform the default UI action associated with the designer.
Default UI actions can include emitting the method associated with the default event in the code-beside file when a user double clicks the designer surface.
Gets a value that indicates whether the activity designer can be resized in a free form designer.
Unless overridden in a derived class, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.EnableVisualResizing%2A> always returns `false`.
`true` if the activity designer can be resized in a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeFormActivityDesigner"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Shifts the visible area of the screen to guarantee that the specified designer is visible.
Use this method to move the visible area of the designer surface to show the designer of interest.
When overridden in a derived class, allows an object to clean up any resources deterministically.
This method cleans up resources by calling <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.Dispose%2A>(`false`).
Override <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.Dispose%2A> to customize the cleanup.
Returns a read-only collection of connection points for the activity designer along the specified <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerEdges"></xref>.
All connection points are in logical coordinates.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerEdges"></xref> along which to gather the connection points.

A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ConnectionPoint"></xref> generic read-only collection that is used as the points at which the activity designer can connect to other activity designers.
Returns a read-only collection of points that the designer uses for connections.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerEdges"></xref> on which to query for points.
A point read-only collection that contains the connections to use for the activity designer.
Gets the image of the activity designer on the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> object used to draw the image.

An <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> object that contains a bitmap used as a preview image in the drag-and-drop operations and in the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.ConditionedActivityGroup"></xref> preview pane.
Returns the designer associated with the design surface of the workflow.
An object that implements the <xref href="System.IServiceProvider"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> that is the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost.RootComponent"></xref> of the designer host.
Tries to retrieve the specified type of service from the design mode site for the activity associated with the designer.
The type of service to request.
An object implementing the requested service or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if the service cannot be resolved.
Gets a collection of glyphs with which to adorn the designer.
Use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.Glyphs%2A> to access a read-only list of designer glyphs.
These glyphs can be used to graphically represent components of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> in a graphical environment.
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerGlyphCollection"></xref> that contains the glyphs to display on the designer.
Gets information about the ActivityDesigner at a specified point on the screen.

The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo>, together with the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.HitTest%2A> method of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> control is used to determine which part of an <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> control the user has clicked.

The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo> contains logical coordinates of the point on the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> where the mouse was clicked.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.HitTest%2A> method receives a <xref:System.Drawing.Point> that contains an x and y coordinate.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> that represents a single x and y coordinate.

A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo"></xref> that contains information about the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> at a specified point.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> associated with the designer.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.Image%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Drawing.Image> to display.
You can do this at design time or at run time.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> associated with the designer.
Gets the value for the enclosing bounds of the image associated with the designer in logical coordinates.
Use the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.ImageRectangle%2A> to retrieve the coordinates for the rectangle that encloses the image associated with the designer.
You can use these coordinates for drawing connectors or overlaying graphics.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> image.
Initializes the designer with the associated <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref>.
Initialize loads the designer with the Activity specified.
The designer loads the Activity service, updates the verbs associated with the activity and assigns the default text and image to the designer.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> with which the designer should be initialized.
Invalidates the designer.
Use Invalidate to cause designer to be repainted.
Invalidates the specified rectangle on the designer.
Use Invalidate to cause the specified rectangle on the designer to be repainted.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the area on the workflow to invalidate.
Gets or sets the designer of the activity that invokes the activity associated with the current activity designer.

Unless overridden in a derived class, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.InvokingDesigner%2A> get operation returns a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) and the set operation throws a <xref:System.NotSupportedException>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref> to invoke the current activity designer.
A set operation was attempted on <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.InvokingDesigner"></xref>.
Returns a value that indicates whether the current designer's activity is commented or is inside a commented activity.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> in the current activity designer.
`true` if the activity is commented or is inside a commented activity; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the activity associated with the designer can be modified.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.IsLocked%2A> determines whether an activity can be modified.
This affects drag operations, changes to properties, and changes to the position of the activity in the designer window.
`true` if the activity associated with the designer can be modified; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the activity associated with the designer is the primary selection.
You can use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.IsPrimarySelection%2A> to affect highlighting or update property sheets in your graphical representation of the workflow.
IsPrimarySelection is useful when multiple activities are selected as IsPrimarySelection will indicate the starting point of a multiple selection.
`true` if the activity associated with the designer is the primary selection; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the designer is a root designer.
The root designer will have no designers as its parent.
The root designer acts as the designer for the complete workflow as all workflow components will be children.
`true` if the designer is a root designer; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the activity associated with the designer is selected.

Use the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.IsSelected%2A> property for operations such as cut and paste, or updating the properties of an Activity when changes are made in a property window, for example.
`true` if the activity associated with the designer is selected; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified activity type is supported if the activity designer is a root designer.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.IsSupportedActivityType%2A> is called only if the activity designer is a root designer.
The type of the activity that was supported.
`true` if the activityType is supported; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the activity associated with the designer is visible on the workflow.
Use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.IsVisible%2A> to determine whether an activity is visible on the designer.
For large workflows you could provide a search mechanism and locate, select, and move into the viewable area an activity currently not visible found by the user.
`true` if the activity associated with the designer is visible on the workflow; otherwise, `false`.
Loads the view state of the designer from a binary stream.
A <xref href="System.IO.BinaryReader"></xref> used to restore the designer state.
Gets or sets the location of the designer in logical coordinates.
Use the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.Location%2A> property to position the designer on the design surface at design time or run time.
The location of the designer in logical coordinates.
Gets a read-only collection of message filters that are associated with the activity designer.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerMessageFilter"></xref> read-only collection that includes all standard message filters to associate with the activity designer.
Gets the minimum size for the activity designer.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.MinimumSize%2A> is determined by the size settings accessible through the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.DesignerTheme%2A> property.
The minimum size of the activity designer.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> when the activity it is associated with changes.
`e` contains data about what changes were made to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity>.
You can use this method to update the designer state and the UI displayed on the workflow designer when a user makes changes to an activity at design time.
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityChangedEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.

Notifies the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> when a user starts to visually resize the activity designer when the designer is in a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeFormActivityDesigner"></xref>.

You can use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnBeginResizing%2A> to perform any design-time processing of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> when a user starts resizing the activity designer.
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerResizeEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> when a connection is established between two connection points.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnConnected%2A> has no default behavior.
You must override this method in a class that derives from <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> to provide processing when a connection is made between two designers.
The source ConnectionPoint on the current activity designer.
The target ConnectionPoint on the activity designer to connect to.
Occurs when the drag-drop operation is completed inside designer bounds.
This event occurs when a drag-drop operation ends within the designer bounds.
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDragEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Occurs when the drag-drop operation is in progress and the pointer enters the designer bounds.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragEnter%2A> event is raised when the mouse is dragged into the designer.
The following describes how and when events related to drag-and-drop operations are raised.
If the designer is a valid drop target, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> event is raised with the drag-and-drop effect specified.
For a list of drag-and-drop effects, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects> enumeration.
Changes in the pointer position, keyboard state, and mouse comment state are tracked.
If the user moves out of the designer bounds, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragLeave%2A> event is raised.
If the mouse enters another designer, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragEnter%2A> for that designer is raised.
If the mouse moves but stays within the same designer, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> event is raised.

If there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnQueryContinueDrag%2A> event is raised and determines whether to continue the drag, to drop the data, or to cancel the operation based on the value of the Action property of the event <xref:System.Windows.Forms.QueryContinueDragEventArgs>.

If the value is `DragAction.Continue`, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> event is raised to continue the operation and the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> event is raised with the new effect so appropriate visual feedback can be set.
For a list of valid drop effects, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects> enumeration.

The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> events are paired so that as the mouse moves across the drop target, the user is supplied with the most up to date feedback on the mouse position.

If the value is `DragAction.Drop`, the drop effect value is returned to the source, so that the source application can perform the appropriate operation on the source data; for example, see comment the data if the operation was a move.
If the value is `DragAction.Cancel`, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragLeave%2A> event is raised.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDragEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Occurs when the drag-drop operation is in progress and the pointer leaves the designer bounds.

The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragLeave%2A> event is raised when the user drags the pointer out of the designer or the user cancels the current drag-and-drop operation.
The following describes how and when events related to drag-and-drop operations are raised.
If the designer is a valid drop target, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> event is raised with the drag-and-drop effect specified.
For a list of drag-and-drop effects, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects> enumeration.
Changes in the pointer position, keyboard state, and mouse button state are tracked.
If the user moves out of the designer bounds, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragLeave%2A> event is raised.
If the mouse enters another designer, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragEnter%2A> for that designer is raised.
If the mouse moves but stays within the same designer, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> event is raised.

If there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnQueryContinueDrag%2A> event is raised and determines whether to continue the drag, to drop the data, or to cancel the operation based on the value of the Action property of the event <xref:System.Windows.Forms.QueryContinueDragEventArgs>.

If the value is `DragAction.Continue`, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> event is raised to continue the operation and the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> event is raised with the new effect so appropriate visual feedback can be set.
For a list of valid drop effects, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects> enumeration.

The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> events are paired so that as the mouse moves across the drop target, the user is supplied with the most up to date feedback on the mouse position.

If the value is `DragAction.Drop`, the drop effect value is returned to the source, so that the source application can perform the appropriate operation on the source data; for example, cut the data if the operation was a move.
If the value is `DragAction.Cancel`, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragLeave%2A> event is raised.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Occurs when the drag-drop operation is in progress and the pointer is within the designer bounds.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> event is raised when the user drags the pointer over of the designer.
The following describes how and when events related to drag-and-drop operations are raised.
If the designer is a valid drop target, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> event is raised with the drag-and-drop effect specified.
For a list of drag-and-drop effects, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects> enumeration.
Changes in the pointer position, keyboard state, and mouse button state are tracked.
If the user moves out of the designer bounds, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragLeave%2A> event is raised.
If the mouse enters another designer, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragEnter%2A> for that designer is raised.
If the mouse moves but stays within the same designer, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> event is raised.

If there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnQueryContinueDrag%2A> event is raised and determines whether to continue the drag, to drop the data, or to cancel the operation based on the value of the Action property of the event <xref:System.Windows.Forms.QueryContinueDragEventArgs>.

If the value is `DragAction.Continue`, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> event is raised to continue the operation and the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> event is raised with the new effect so appropriate visual feedback can be set.
For a list of valid drop effects, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects> enumeration.

The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> events are paired so that as the mouse moves across the drop target, the user is supplied with the most up to date feedback on the mouse position.

If the value is `DragAction.Drop`, the drop effect value is returned to the source, so that the source application can perform the appropriate operation on the source data; for example, cut the data if the operation was a move.
If the value is `DragAction.Cancel`, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragLeave%2A> event is raised.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDragEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.

Notifies the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> when a user is finished visually resizing the activity designer when the designer is in a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeFormActivityDesigner"></xref>.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> when the user clicks on the configuration errors associated with the designer.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerAction"></xref> associated with the configuration error.
designerAction contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Updates the visual cues for feedback supplied to the user when performing a drag operation.
The following describes how and when events related to drag-and-drop operations are raised.
If the designer is a valid drop target, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> event is raised with the drag-and-drop effect specified.
For a list of drag-and-drop effects, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects> enumeration.
Changes in the pointer position, keyboard state, and mouse button state are tracked.
If the user moves out of the designer bounds, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnMouseLeave%2A> event is raised.
If the mouse enters another designer, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragEnter%2A> for that designer is raised.
If the mouse moves but stays within the same designer, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> event is raised.

If there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnQueryContinueDrag%2A> event is raised and determines whether to continue the drag, to drop the data, or to cancel the operation based on the value of the Action property of the event <xref:System.Windows.Forms.QueryContinueDragEventArgs>.

If the value is `DragAction.Continue`, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> event is raised to continue the operation and the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> event is raised with the new effect so appropriate visual feedback can be set.
For a list of valid drop effects, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects> enumeration.

The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> events are paired so that as the mouse moves across the drop target, the user is supplied with the most up to date feedback on the mouse position.

If the value is `DragAction.Drop`, the drop effect value is returned to the source, so that the source application can perform the appropriate operation on the source data; for example, cut the data if the operation was a move.
If the value is `DragAction.Cancel`, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragLeave%2A> event is raised.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.GiveFeedbackEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Occurs when a key is pressed when the designer has the keyboard focus.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Occurs when a key is released when the designer has keyboard focus.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> when a user repositions its visual cues or child activity designers.
You should override this method to perform any layout processing required when a user repositions items on the activity designer surface at design time.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerLayoutEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
e contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Returns the size of the visual cues or child activity designers on the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerLayoutEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
The new size settings for the visual cues or child activity designers.
e contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Occurs when the mouse capture changes.
OnMouseCaptureChanged occurs when the user selects a number of objects on the designer by dragging the mouse pointer.
Occurs when the mouse button is clicked multiple times on the designer.
OnMouseDoubleClick occurs when the mouse button is clicked twice in succession above a designer.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Occurs when the mouse button is pressed when the pointer is in designer bounds.
The following describes how and when events related to drag-and-drop operations are raised.
If the designer is a valid drop target, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> event is raised with the drag-and-drop effect specified.
For a list of drag-and-drop effects, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects> enumeration.
Changes in the pointer position, keyboard state, and mouse button state are tracked.
If the user moves out of the designer bounds, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragLeave%2A> event is raised.
If the mouse enters another designer, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragEnter%2A> for that designer is raised.
If the mouse moves but stays within the same designer, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> event is raised.

If there is a change in the keyboard or mouse button state, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnQueryContinueDrag%2A> event is raised and determines whether to continue the drag, to drop the data, or to cancel the operation based on the value of the Action property of the event <xref:System.Windows.Forms.QueryContinueDragEventArgs>.

If the value is `DragAction.Continue`, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> event is raised to continue the operation and the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> event is raised with the new effect so appropriate visual feedback can be set.
For a list of valid drop effects, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DragDropEffects> enumeration.

The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragOver%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnGiveFeedback%2A> events are paired so that as the mouse moves across the drop target, the user is supplied with the most up to date feedback on the mouse position.

If the value is `DragAction.Drop`, the drop effect value is returned to the source, so that the source application can perform the appropriate operation on the source data; for example, cut the data if the operation was a move.
If the value is `DragAction.Cancel`, the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnDragLeave%2A> event is raised.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Occurs when the user starts to drag the mouse on the designer.

Draws the visual representation of the activity at design time.
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerPaintEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
e contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Allows the designer to process raw Win32 messages.
A Win32 <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref> that contains the event data.
Controls whether the drag operation should continue.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.QueryContinueDragEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> when a user is visually resizing it at design time.
The method is only called if the activity designer is a child of a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.FreeFormActivityDesigner"></xref>.
`e` specifies the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerEdges> and new bounds being used for the resized <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerResizeEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> when a user changes the scroll position.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.OnScroll%2A> provide no default behavior.
You must override it in a class that derives from <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> to provide processing logic when a scroll position changes.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar"></xref> on which the user changed position.
The new scroll position value.
Displays the designer verbs associated with a smart tag at the specified point.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> that designates the location to show the smart tag.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> whether a smart tag should be displayed or hidden.
`true` to indicate that the smart tag should be displayed; `false` to indicate that the smart tag should be hidden.
Notifies the designer that the associated theme has changed.
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerTheme"></xref> that contains the event data.
Gets the parent designer of the existing designer.

You can use the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.ParentDesigner%2A> to move up the tree of nested <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> objects or to find the root designer.
The parent designer of the existing designer.

If the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> is a root designer then the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref> returned will be the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialWorkflowRootDesigner"></xref>; otherwise, the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> will be the parent <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref>.
Gets the workflow view that contains the current activity designer.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowView"></xref> that contains the current activity designer.
Updates the layout of the designer.
Transforms a point from screen coordinate system to the activity designer coordinate system.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> that contains the coordinates to transform.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> that contains the transformed x and y coordinates.
Transforms a point from the activity designer coordinate system to the screen coordinate system.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> that contains the coordinates to transform.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Point"></xref> that contains the transformed x and y coordinates.
When overridden in a derived class, allows a designer to change or remove items from the set of attributes that it exposes through a TypeDescriptor.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains the TypeID values of the attributes.
When overridden in a derived class, allows the designer to change or remove items from the set of events that it exposes through a TypeDescriptor.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains the event names of the class.
When overridden in a derived class, allows a designer to change or remove items from the set of properties that it exposes through a TypeDescriptor.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains the property names of the class.
When overridden in a derived class, allows a designer to add items to the set of attributes that it exposes through a TypeDescriptor.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains the TypeID values of the attributes.
When overridden in a derived class, allows a designer to add items to the set of events that it exposes through a TypeDescriptor.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains the event names of the class.
When overridden in a derived class, allows a designer to add items to the set of properties that it exposes through a TypeDescriptor.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains the property names of the class.
Transforms a rectangle from the screen coordinate system to the activity designer coordinate system.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that describes the coordinates to transform.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that describes the transformed coordinates.
Transforms a rectangle from the activity designer coordinate system to the screen coordinate system.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that describes the coordinates to transform.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that describes the transformed coordinates.
Refreshes the configuration errors associated with the designer.
Designer actions represent the possible configuration errors associated with a designer.
Calling <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.RefreshDesignerActions%2A> updates these errors with any recent changes.
Refreshes the activity designer verbs associated with the designer by calling the status handler.
Designer verbs are shown in context menus and menu bars.
Calling <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.RefreshDesignerVerbs%2A> will refresh the menus to show any recent changes.
Stores the view state of the designer into a binary stream.
The view state is the accumulation of the values of designer properties.
When the view state is saved to a stream, the designer values and settings can be restored using <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.LoadViewState%2A>.
The <xref href="System.IO.BinaryWriter"></xref> into which the view state is stored.
Displays the info tip for the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> with the specified title and text.
A string that contains the title of the info tip.
A string that contains the info tip text to display.
Shows the specified info tip.
Use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.ShowInfoTip%2A> to show a rectangle of text that can be used to display extended information about the designer.
The text to display in the InfoTip.
Displays the specified tool tip in the specified rectangle location.
A string that contains the tool tip to display.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that defines the location at which to display the tool tip.
Gets a value that indicates whether the activity should show a smart tag.
Use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.ShowSmartTag%2A> to determine whether to show a smart tag when an activity has focus in the designer.
`true` if the activity should show a SmartTag; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the size of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref>.
Use size to adjust the height and width of the activity designer.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the area of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref>.
Gets the rectangle where the smart tag should be displayed.

Use together with <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.ShowSmartTag%2A> and <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.SmartTagVerbs%2A> to display a smart tag of available designer actions at the location specified by <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.SmartTagRectangle%2A>.
The rectangle where the smart tag should be displayed.
Gets a read-only collection of designer actions to associate with a smart tag on the activity designer.
An <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesignerVerb"></xref> read-only collection to associate with the activity designer's smart tag.
Gets or sets the text to associate with the designer.
Use to associate a text string with the designer.
The text to associate with the designer.
Gets the value of the text rectangle in logical coordinates.
Use to determine the location on the designer where <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.Text%2A> will be displayed.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the text associated with the designer.
Gets the collection of verbs to be associated with the designer.
Use the Verbs method to determine the verbs to show on the Context Menu.
The collection of verbs to be associated with the designer.
Gets the base component with which the activity designer is associated.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.System%23ComponentModel%23Design%23IDesigner%23Component> represents the activity that the activity designer designs on the workflow design surface.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> with which the activity designer is associated.
Performs the default action associated with the designer.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.DoDefaultAction%2A> causes the default action associated with the designer to be executed.
Initializes the designer with the associated activity.
The IComponent to initialize the designer with.
Gets the design-time verbs associated with the activity designer.
The design-time verbs associated with the activity designer.
When overridden in a derived class, allows a designer to change or remove items from the set of attributes that it exposes through a TypeDescriptor.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains the TypeIDs of the attributes of the class.
When overridden in a derived class, allows a designer to change or remove items from the set of events that it exposes through a TypeDescriptor.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains the event names of the class.
When overridden in a derived class, allows a designer to change or remove items from the set of properties that it exposes through a TypeDescriptor.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains the property names of the class.
When overridden in a derived class, allows a designer to add items to the set of attributes that it exposes through a TypeDescriptor.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains the TypeIDs of the attributes of the class.
When overridden in a derived class, allows a designer to add items to the set of events that it exposes through a TypeDescriptor.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains the event names of the class.
When overridden in a derived class, allows a designer to add items to the set of properties that it exposes through a TypeDescriptor.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains the property names of the class.
Returns a view object for the specified view technology.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> is cast to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IRootDesigner> interface.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IRootDesigner.GetView%2A>.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.ViewTechnology"></xref> for which to return the view object.
An object that represents the view for this designer.
Gets the array of technologies that the activity designer can support for its display.

Unless overridden in a deriving class, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.System%23ComponentModel%23Design%23IRootDesigner%23SupportedTechnologies> returns a single-member array that contains <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ViewTechnology?displayProperty=fullName>.
An array of supported <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.ViewTechnology"></xref> objects.
Determines whether the specified Toolbox item is supported by the current activity designer.
For more information, see <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxUser.GetToolSupported%2A>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to test for support.
`true` if the tool is supported by the toolbox and can be enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Selects the specified toolbox item.
For more information, see <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxUser.ToolPicked%2A>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem"></xref> to select.
Restores the view state from a binary stream.
The <xref href="System.IO.BinaryReader"></xref> to load the view state from.
Saves the view state to a binary stream.
A <xref href="System.IO.BinaryWriter"></xref> to save the view state to.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref> that requested the activity designer be initialized.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.CompositeActivityDesigner"></xref> that requested the activity designer be initialized.
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified type is supported on the current <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref>.
IsSupportedActivityType is called only if the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> is a root designer.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the activity to check for support on the activity designer.
`true` if the type is supported on the current workflow designer; otherwise, `false`.
Gets any message filters associated with the activity designer.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.WorkflowDesignerMessageFilter"></xref> read-only collection that contains any message filters associated with the workflow root designer.
Gets the value that indicates whether the actual workflow root designer supports the layout persistence.
`true` if the designer supports layout persistence; otherwise, `false`.
